Description: Small pendant made of a fine brown Nile clay with mica and few voids from organic temper. The shape is biconical getting thicker towards the middle of the objects (diamond shaped), somewhat irregular. Both ends are rounded and the upper end shows a horizontal perforation to attach the pendant. A small area between the perforation and the upper end shows marks from the string. The perforation has a diameter of 0.3 cm.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 131)
